ANDS-Grants.description: The aim of this project is to determine whether the early teaching of the modern Einsteinian paradigm of physics improves students' understanding of physics and attitudes to science. Following pilot studies that affirmed that young students could understand the basic physics that underpins our current best understanding of space, time, matter and radiation, we plan to find out whether it is feasible to teach all students the physics that underpins modern technology. We expect that by introducing students to the paradigm of Einsteinian physics before they learn the useful Newtonian approximations, we will improve their engagement and understanding of physics. This is critical to Australia as enrolments in the hard sciences plummet.
